org.spongepowered.api.data

Interface DataRegistration.Builder<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>

extends CatalogBuilder<DataRegistration<T,I>,DataRegistration.Builder<T,I>>

      • dataClass

        <D extends DataManipulator<D,M>,M extends ImmutableDataManipulator<M,D>> DataRegistration.Builder<D,M> dataClass(Class<D> manipulatorClass)
        Sets the DataManipulator class to be used. For the sake of generics, this method must be called prior to immutableClass(Class) to properly infer generic usage by the compiler and at runtime.
        Type Parameters:
        D - The type of data manipulator
        M - The type of immutable data manipulator
        Parameters:
        manipulatorClass - The manipulator class
        Returns:
        This builder, properly generified, for chaining

      • immutableClass

                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Sets the immutable class. THIS MUST BE CALLED AFTER dataClass(Class)!
        Parameters:
        immutableDataClass - The immutable data class
        Returns:
        This builder, for chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If the data manipulator class has not been set already

      • manipulatorId

        @Deprecated
default DataRegistration.Builder<T,I> manipulatorId(String id)
        Deprecated. Use CatalogBuilder.id(String) instead
        Sets the id for the manipulator. The id should be formatted according to the normal CatalogType standard: {manipulator-id| since the "pluginid" is gathered from buildAndRegister(PluginContainer) provided PluginContainer.

        The importance of the id is that the id is what will be used for serialization and deserialization of custom plugin provided data, such that if the string changes, or a plugin is no longer available to register the data, the custom data being deserialized will not be available through the system, and may be lost.

        Parameters:
        id - The id for the manipulator
        Returns:
        This builder, for chaining

      • dataName

        @Deprecated
default DataRegistration.Builder<T,I> dataName(String name)
        Deprecated. Use CatalogBuilder.name(String) instead
        Sets a more generalized name to refer to the registered DataManipulator as a common name.

        As an example: if I have a DummyTestData, a name could be "Dummy".

        Parameters:
        name - The data name
        Returns:
        This builder, for chaining

      • from

        @Deprecated
DataRegistration.Builder<T,I> from(DataRegistration<T,I> value)
                                        throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Deprecated. 
        Since DataRegistration objects should be considered singletons in that the data registered upon creation is already preformed, creating a new DataRegistration will always fail.
        Specified by:
        from in interface CatalogBuilder<DataRegistration<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>,DataRegistration.Builder<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>>
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        value - The built object
        Returns:
        This builder, but will fail
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Always will throw an exception since there can not be multiple registration objects for the same data

      • reset

        DataRegistration.Builder<T,I> reset()
        Description copied from interface: ResettableBuilder
        Resets this builder to a "default" state such that there is no remaining data to set. This is to be the presumed "default" state.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface ResettableBuilder<DataRegistration<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>,DataRegistration.Builder<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>>
        Returns:
        This builder, for chaining

      • buildAndRegister

        @Deprecated
default DataRegistration<T,I> buildAndRegister(PluginContainer container)
                                                    throws IllegalStateException,
                                                           IllegalArgumentException,
                                                           DataAlreadyRegisteredException
        Deprecated. Use build() instead
        Registers all of the objects for the provided DataRegistration object, including the registration's DataRegistration.getManipulatorClass() for the DataManipulator and DataRegistration.getImmutableManipulatorClass() and DataRegistration.getDataManipulatorBuilder() object. More importantly, this also allows the proper identification of the DataManipulator itself by the provided DataRegistration.getId(), which, much like CatalogType.getId() is formatted with {plugin-id|:{manipulator-id|.

        It is expected that as the required PluginContainer is used is not a default container from Sponge. The PluginContainer.getId() is utilized to generate the final DataRegistration.getId() for serialization purposes.

        Returns:
        The data registration object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If registrations can no longer take place
        IllegalArgumentException - Various reasons
        DataAlreadyRegisteredException - If the classes and or builder has already been registered

      • build

        DataRegistration<T,I> build()
        Builds the CatalogType of type C.

        The last PluginContainer in the cause stack will be used to determine which plugin was used to construct the CatalogType.

        All of the objects for the provided DataRegistration object, including the registration's DataRegistration.getManipulatorClass() for the DataManipulator and DataRegistration.getImmutableManipulatorClass() and DataRegistration.getDataManipulatorBuilder() object will also be registered.
        Specified by:
        build in interface CatalogBuilder<DataRegistration<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>,DataRegistration.Builder<T extends DataManipulator<T,I>,I extends ImmutableDataManipulator<I,T>>>
        Returns:
        The data registration object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If registrations can no longer take place
        IllegalArgumentException - Various reasons
        DataAlreadyRegisteredException - If the classes and or builder has already been registered
